result.execSummary:
The defendant James Ernest Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.
No driving without a valid license.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Ernest Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Ernest Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant James Ernest Smith in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for zero days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for one year with the following conditions: 
pay municipal ticket for possession 
*no driving without a valid license
*pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  

* NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant James Ernest Smith not in court, in custody.  Colin P. McGinn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant James Ernest Smith not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defense requests an earlier Plea and Sentencing date. Court date on 8/24/2015 vacated. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant James Ernest Smith not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant appearance waived. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Ernest Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court date signed and filed. Defense received discovery and an offer. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Ernest Smith in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/16/15 @ 1:30 pm
